channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for NJ
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for NJ

item.title: Report X-2023100835
item.description:
Report X-2023100835

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-13T18:12:55+00:00

  • City: BARRINGTON
  • State: NJ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: A package handler was loading the hazmat into the trailer and it was dropped and it had caused a leakage in one bottle. DescribePack: The package had a crack at the bottom of the bottle and it had caused to leak all over inside the package. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: A manager was able to have a red tote and a plastic clear bag near by and was able to put the damage hazmat into the tote taking precaution.

item.title: Report X-2023100634
item.description:
Report X-2023100634

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-13T18:12:55+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-03
  • City: BARRINGTON
  • State: NJ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: DURING THE UNLOAD PROCESS THE MANAGER NOTICED THAT THE PACKAGE WAS WET AND ON IT'S SIDE. MANAGER IMMEDIATELY TOOK PACKAGE OVER TO THE HAZMAT CAGE TO SECURE AND VENTILATE PACKAGE PROPERLY. I WAS THEN CALLED OVER TO HANDLE THE REPACK PROCESS. I THEN REPACKED THE PACKAGE INTO A YELLOW SALVAGE DRUM SAFELY AND SECURELY AND ALSO IN A TIMELY FASHION. DescribePack: PART B HAD A LOOSE CAP AND WHEN BOX WAS TURNED ON IT'S SIDE THE LOOSE CAP CAUSE IT TO LEAK APPROXIMATELY 1 CUP OUT ONTO THE PACKAGE AND THE INNER CONTAINERS OF PART A. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: I REPACKED IT INTO A YELLOW SALVAGE DRUM IN A SAFE AND TIMELY FASHION TO AVOID ANY FURTHER EXPOSURE FOR THE CHEMICALS.

item.title: Report X-2023100627
item.description:
Report X-2023100627

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-13T18:12:55+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-02
  • City: KEASBEY
  • State: NJ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: DURING THE OVERNIGHT SORT THE PACKAGE WAS BROUGHT TO THE HAZMAT CAGE SHOWING OBVIOUS SIGNS OF INTERNAL LEAKAGE. UPON FURTHER INSPECTION 1 BOTTLE OF ETHYL ACETATE WAS FOUND CRACKED AND FULLY LEAKED OUT. THE PACKAGE WAS HURRIEDLY PLACED IN A SALVAGE DRUM TO BE RETURNED TO THE SHIPPER UNLESS OTHERWISE. DescribePack: FAILURE OF THE PACKAGE WAS CAUSED FROM THE BOX BEING DROPPED AND 1 BOTTLE OF ETHYL ACETATE BECAME CRACKED. DurationRel: 4 and MitigateEffect: THE REMAINING CONTENTS WERE PLACED IN A LINED SALAVAGE DRUM TO AWAIT DISPOSITION.

item.title: Report E-2023110055
item.description:
Report E-2023110055

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-07T18:15:22+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-19
  • City: BURLINGTON
  • State: NJ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On October 19, 2023, one (1) 55-gallon drum of UN1760 was punctured by a forklift and released approximately one (1) gallon of product to the dock surface. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from First Call Environmental (FCE) to remediate the impacted site. Crews collected the damaged drum and placed in in one (1) 85-gallon over pack. FCE personnel utilized hand tools to collect all granular absorbents applied by RLC. All ammonium hydroxide impacted material was collected and containerized in one (1) 55-gallon drum and both drums were added to RLC waste stream for disposal.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: PACKAGE WAS FOUND UNDER THE CONVEYOR BELT IN A HAZMAT BIN. DPR, ISF, 105 WAS DONE. PKG WAS REPACKED AND RETURN LABLE WAS DONE. PKG WAS PLACED IN THE HAZMAT CAGE AWAITING DISPOSITION DescribePack: LOOSE CAP DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: THE PACKAGE WAS PROCESS AND PREPACKED AND PLACED IN THE HAZMAT CAGE, WHILE AWAITING DISPOSITON.

UPON FURTHER INSPECTION A METAL PAIL WAS FOUND WITH THE CONTENTS LEAKED OUT. THE PAIL WAS HURRIEDLY PLACED IN A SALVAGE DRUM TO BE TRASH UNLESS OTHERWISE. DescribePack: FAILURE OF THE PACKAGE WAS CAUSED FROM THE PACKAGE BEING FELL AND GOTTEN A PUNCTURE AT THE BOTTOM DurationRel: 4 and MitigateEffect: THE REMAINING CONTENTS WERE PLACED IN A LINED SALAVAGE DRUM TO AWAIT DISPOSITION.

item.title: Report X-2023100575
item.description:
Report X-2023100575

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-09T18:13:50+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-28
  • City: KEASBEY
  • State: NJ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: IT APPEARS THE SHIPMENT WAS REMOVED FROM THE SYSTEM FLOW, DUE TO THE EXTERNAL CARTON BEING TORN AND WET DURING THE DAY SORT. DescribePack: UPON INSPECTION OF INNER CONTENTS DURING THE TWILIGHT SHIFT 3X1GALLON (PLASTIC BOTTLES) NOBLE DEGREASER. ONLY 3 BOTTLES WERE FOUND LOCATED AND APPEARS ONE OF THE BOTTLE WAS MISSING. ONE BOTTLE HAD A LOOSE CAP WHICH CAUSED LEAKAGING ALLOWING 90% SPILLAGE. WHICH ALSO CAUSED DAMAGE TO THE OUTER PACKAGING AS WELL. DurationRel: 12 and MitigateEffect: FACILITY PROCEDURES FOR DAMAGED HAZARDOUS MATERIAL FOLLOWED, CONTENTS CONTAINED AND AWAITING DISPOSITION.

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The package was found at Hazmat Cage during Day sort, in a plastic drum. DescribePack: Inspection of "GRAINGER TRI-POW'R HD" showed box to be wet from internal leakage caused by loose cap, also one bottle is missing, most likely from being dropped or mishandled. DurationRel: 12 and MitigateEffect: Remaining contents will be returned to shipper in a plastic salvage drum, unless otherwise stated.

DescribePack: Inspection of "ZEP CONCENTRATED INDUSTRIAL PURPLE DEGREASER" showed box to be wet from internal leakage caused by loose cap, most likely from being dropped or mishandled. item.title: Report X-2023100499
item.description:
Report X-2023100499

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-08T18:14:16+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-15
  • City: DOVER
  • State: NJ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: During sort package found leaking wet, discolored and strong chem smell. All signs indicate possible Hazard material. Inspection confirmed inner contents were cool chlorinating liquid and SDS items are considered hazardous. Bottles were individually wrapped but no partition used or packing to protect . DescribePack: Package did not have hazmat decals to indicate hazard shipping, did not have directional arrows which would have indicated top/bottom. inner packaging did not include partitions, liners. top/cap protectors. Outer box too big which led to shifting, as a result inner bottles were able to flip over and became bent. Leak from inner bottles caused outer box to fail DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Once identified, package was separated from other sort and placed in a hazmat bag and bin

item.title: Report X-2023100326
item.description:
Report X-2023100326

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-08T18:14:16+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-26
  • City: SOUTH HACKENSACK
  • State: NJ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: QA was called to trailer to inspect a 20 liter can that had liquid on the top of the can. Gloves, goggles, and an apron were used for PPE. QA used HazMat tote to remove the can and brought to Hazmat cage for further inspection. DescribePack: Closure of can was found to be loose. No holes or cracks. Cap was tightened while in Hazmat cage. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: All employees were removed from the trailer the can was discovered nearby. QA inspected the area and found no liquid in or near the trailer. Can was removed via Hazmat tote and brought to Hazmat cage.

item.title: Report X-2023100308
item.description:
Report X-2023100308

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-08T18:14:16+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-27
  • City: BARRINGTON
  • State: NJ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: DURING THE UNLOAD PROCESS THE MANAGER NOTICED THAT THE PACKAGE WAS WET AND IMMEDIATELY TOOK THE PACKAGE OVER TO THE HAZMAT CAGE TO SECURE IT AND VENTILATE IT PROPERLY. THEY THEN CALLED ME OVER TO PROCESS THE DAMAGE HAZMAT. I THEN REPACKED THE PACKAGE INTO A YELLOW SALVAGE DRUM SAFELY AND SECURELY. DescribePack: ONE OUT OF THE FOUR BOTTLES HAD A LOOSE CAP CAUSING APPROXIAMTELY 2 CUPS OF PRESSURE WASH LIQUID TO LEAK OUT. DurationRel: 2 and MitigateEffect: IMMEDIATELY TAKING PACKAGE OVER TO HAZMAT CAGE AND ALSO IMMEDIATELY CALLING ME OVER TO REPACK INTO YELLOW SALVAGE DRUM SAFELY, SECURELY AND ALSO IN A TIMELY MANNER.
